content: शम् {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} A particle meaning welfare, happiness, prosperity, health, and generally used to express a blessing or pious wish, (with <ab>dat.</ab> or <ab>gen.</ab>); शं देवदत्ताय or देवदत्तस्य (often used in modern letters as an auspicious conclusion; इति शम्).

शम् {vI.v} {c4c} <ab>P.</ab> (शाम्यति, शांत) {@--1@} To be calm, quiet or tranquil, be appeased or pacified; (as a person); शाम्येत्प्रत्यपकारेण नोपकारेण दुर्जनः <ls>Ku. 2. 40</ls>; काकुत्स्थमुद्दिश्य समत्सरोऽपि शशाम तेत क्षितिपाललोकः <ls>R. 7. 3</ls>; शांतो लवः <ls>U. 6. 7.</ls> {@--2@} To cease, stop, come to an end; चिंता शशाम सकलाऽपि सरोरुहाणां <ls>Bv. 3. 7</ls>; न जातु कामः कामानामुपभोगेन शाम्यति <ls>Ms. 2. 94</ls> ‘is not satisfied’. {@--3@} To be quelled, be extinguished or quenched; शशाम वृष्ट्र्यापि विना दवाग्निः <ls>R. 2. 14</ls>, <ls>U. 5. 7.</ls> {@--4@} To desist, leave off (speaking &c.). {@--5@} To put an end to, destroy, kill (also {c9c} <ab>P.</ab> in this sense). {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} (शमयति-ते, but शामयति-ते in the sense of ‘seeing’, see शम् II). {@--1@} To appease, allay, calm, tranquillize, pacify, soothe; कः शीतलैः शमयिता वचनैस्तवाधिं <ls>Bv. 3. 1</ls>; संरंभं शमयामास <ls>R. 15. 85</ls>, <ls n="R.">17. 55</ls>; <ls>Ś. 5. 7.</ls> {@--2@} To put an end, to stop; <ls>Ku. 2. 56.</ls> {@--3@} To remove, avert; प्रतिकूलं दैवं शमयितुं <ls>Ś. 1.</ls> {@--4@} To subdue, tame, defeat, conquer, vanquish; शमयति गजानन्यान् गंधद्विपः कलभोऽपि सन् <ls>V. 5. 18</ls>; <ls>R. 9. 12</ls>, <ls n="R.">11. 59.</ls> {@--5@} To kill, destroy, slay; <ls>Ve. 5. 5.</ls> {@--6@} To quench, extinguish; सुतप्तमपि पानीयं शमयत्येव पावकं <ls>H. 1. 88</ls>, <ls>Me. 53.</ls> {@--7@} To leave off, desist, cease. {vII.v} {c10c} <ab>U.</ab> शामयति-ते {@--1@} To see, look at, inspect. {@--2@} To show, display.
